trans-unit.source: Boosted Decision Tree Regression
trans-unit.target: Boosted Decision Tree Regression

trans-unit.source: Creates a regression model using the Boosted Decision Tree algorithm
trans-unit.target: Creates a regression model using the Boosted Decision Tree algorithm

trans-unit.source: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="97F9510F-60BA-4D78-8A33-3078A6C7F260" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Regression</legacyLink>
trans-unit.target: Category: <legacyLink xlink:href="97F9510F-60BA-4D78-8A33-3078A6C7F260" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Machine Learning / Initialize Model / Regression</legacyLink>

trans-unit.source: Module Overview
trans-unit.target: Module Overview

trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Boosted Decision Tree Regression</ui> module to create an ensemble of regression trees using boosting.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Boosted Decision Tree Regression</ui> module to create an ensemble of regression trees using boosting.

trans-unit.source: <newTerm>Boosting</newTerm> means that each tree is dependent on prior trees, and learns by fitting the residual of the trees that preceded it.
trans-unit.target: <newTerm>Boosting</newTerm> means that each tree is dependent on prior trees, and learns by fitting the residual of the trees that preceded it.

trans-unit.source: Thus, boosting in a decision tree ensemble tends to improve accuracy with some small risk of less coverage.
trans-unit.target: Thus, boosting in a decision tree ensemble tends to improve accuracy with some small risk of less coverage.

trans-unit.source: This regression method is a supervised learning method, and therefore requires a <newTerm>tagged dataset</newTerm>, which includes a label column.
trans-unit.target: This regression method is a supervised learning method, and therefore requires a <newTerm>tagged dataset</newTerm>, which includes a label column.

trans-unit.source: The label column must contain numerical values.
trans-unit.target: The label column must contain numerical values.

trans-unit.source: You can train the model by providing the model and the tagged dataset as an input to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.
trans-unit.target: You can train the model by providing the model and the tagged dataset as an input to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> or <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link>.

trans-unit.source: The trained model can then be used to predict values for the new input examples.
trans-unit.target: The trained model can then be used to predict values for the new input examples.

trans-unit.source: Use this module only with datasets that use numerical variables.
trans-unit.target: Use this module only with datasets that use numerical variables.

trans-unit.source: Understanding Boosted Regression Trees
trans-unit.target: Understanding Boosted Regression Trees

trans-unit.source: Boosting is one of several classic methods for creating ensemble models, along with bagging, random forests, and so forth.
trans-unit.target: Boosting is one of several classic methods for creating ensemble models, along with bagging, random forests, and so forth.

trans-unit.source: In Azure Machine Learning Studio, boosted decision trees use an efficient implementation of the MART gradient boosting algorithm.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Machine Learning Studio, boosted decision trees use an efficient implementation of the MART gradient boosting algorithm.

trans-unit.source: Gradient boosting is a machine learning technique for regression problems.
trans-unit.target: Gradient boosting is a machine learning technique for regression problems.

trans-unit.source: It builds each regression tree in a step-wise fashion, using a predefined loss function to measure the error in each step and correct for it in the next.
trans-unit.target: It builds each regression tree in a step-wise fashion, using a predefined loss function to measure the error in each step and correct for it in the next.

trans-unit.source: Thus the prediction model is actually an ensemble of weaker prediction models.
trans-unit.target: Thus the prediction model is actually an ensemble of weaker prediction models.

trans-unit.source: In regression problems, boosting builds a series of trees in in a step-wise fashion, and then selects the optimal tree using an arbitrary differentiable loss function.
trans-unit.target: In regression problems, boosting builds a series of trees in in a step-wise fashion, and then selects the optimal tree using an arbitrary differentiable loss function.

trans-unit.source: For additional information, see these articles:
trans-unit.target: For additional information, see these articles:

trans-unit.source: Wikipedia article on boosted trees.
trans-unit.target: Wikipedia article on boosted trees.

trans-unit.source: In particular see the section about gradient tree boosting.
trans-unit.target: In particular see the section about gradient tree boosting.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Research: From RankNet to LambdaRank to LambdaMART: An OverviewC.J.C. Burges.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Research: From RankNet to LambdaRank to LambdaMART: An OverviewC.J.C. Burges.

trans-unit.source: http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=132652
trans-unit.target: http://research.microsoft.com/apps/pubs/default.aspx?id=132652

trans-unit.source: The gradient boosting method can also be used for classification problems by reducing them to regression with a suitable loss function.
trans-unit.target: The gradient boosting method can also be used for classification problems by reducing them to regression with a suitable loss function.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the boosted trees implementation for classification tasks, see <link xlink:href="e3c522f8-53d9-4829-8ea4-5c6a6b75330c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Two-class</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the boosted trees implementation for classification tasks, see <link xlink:href="e3c522f8-53d9-4829-8ea4-5c6a6b75330c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Two-class</link>.

trans-unit.source: How to Configure a Boosted Decision Tree Regression Model
trans-unit.target: How to Configure a Boosted Decision Tree Regression Model

trans-unit.source: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: Specify how you want the model to be trained, by setting the <ui>Create trainer mode</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: When you create this model, you have two options for training the model: using a single set of parameters with <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, or choosing a range of parameters and training the model with a parameter sweep.
trans-unit.target: When you create this model, you have two options for training the model: using a single set of parameters with <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, or choosing a range of parameters and training the model with a parameter sweep.

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter mode
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter mode

trans-unit.source: If you know how you want to configure the regression model, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.
trans-unit.target: If you know how you want to configure the regression model, you can provide a specific set of values as arguments.

trans-unit.source: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.
trans-unit.target: You might have learned these values by experimentation or received them as guidance.

trans-unit.source: Sweep mode
trans-unit.target: Sweep mode

trans-unit.source: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> to train the model.
trans-unit.target: If you are not sure of the best parameters, you can find the optimal parameters by using <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> to train the model.

trans-unit.source: If you choose the <ui>Single Parameter</ui> option, type other values in the <ui>Properties</ui> pane that control the behavior of the regression model, such as leaves per tree and learning rate.
trans-unit.target: If you choose the <ui>Single Parameter</ui> option, type other values in the <ui>Properties</ui> pane that control the behavior of the regression model, such as leaves per tree and learning rate.

trans-unit.source: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.
trans-unit.target: See the <legacyLink xlink:href="#bkmk_Options" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Options</legacyLink> section for details.

trans-unit.source: Then, connect the model to the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module, along with a labeled training dataset, and run the experiment
trans-unit.target: Then, connect the model to the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module, along with a labeled training dataset, and run the experiment

trans-unit.source: If you choose the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option, use the <ui>Range Builder</ui> to set an upper and lower range for each numeric parameter.
trans-unit.target: If you choose the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option, use the <ui>Range Builder</ui> to set an upper and lower range for each numeric parameter.

trans-unit.source: Then, connect the model to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> module, along with a labeled training dataset, and run the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Then, connect the model to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> module, along with a labeled training dataset, and run the experiment.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> will iterate over all possible combinations of the settings you provided and determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Sweep Parameters</link> will iterate over all possible combinations of the settings you provided and determine the combination of settings that produces the optimal results.

trans-unit.source: You can use the model trained using those parameters, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.
trans-unit.target: You can use the model trained using those parameters, or you can make a note of the parameter settings to use when configuring a learner.

trans-unit.source: Options
trans-unit.target: Options

trans-unit.source: You can customize the behavior of the regression model by using these parameters:
trans-unit.target: You can customize the behavior of the regression model by using these parameters:

trans-unit.source: Create trainer mode
trans-unit.target: Create trainer mode

trans-unit.source: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:
trans-unit.target: Choose the method used for configuring and training the model:

trans-unit.source: Single Parameter
trans-unit.target: Single Parameter

trans-unit.source: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to configure and train the model with a single set of parameter values that you supply.

trans-unit.source: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.
trans-unit.target: If you choose this option, you should train the model by using the <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link> module.

trans-unit.source: Parameter Range
trans-unit.target: Parameter Range

trans-unit.source: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to use the Range Builder and specify a range of possible values.

trans-unit.source: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.
trans-unit.target: You then train the model using a parameter sweep, to find the optimum configuration.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a parameter range to <link xlink:href="5cc7053e-aa30-450d-96c0-dae4be720977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Train Model</link>, it will use only the first value in the parameter range list.

trans-unit.source: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.
trans-unit.target: If you pass a single set of parameter values to the <link xlink:href="038d91b6-c2f2-42a1-9215-1f2c20ed1b40" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Parameter sweep</link> module, when it expects a range of settings for each parameter, it ignores the values and using the default values for the learner.

trans-unit.source: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.
trans-unit.target: If you select the <ui>Parameter Range</ui> option and enter a single value for any parameter, that single value you specified will be used throughout the sweep, even if other parameters change across a range of values.

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of leaves per tree
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of leaves per tree

trans-unit.source: Type a value to constrain the number of leaves in the tree.
trans-unit.target: Type a value to constrain the number of leaves in the tree.

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of samples per leaf node
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of samples per leaf node

trans-unit.source: Type a value that defines the number of cases required to form any single terminal node, or leaf.
trans-unit.target: Type a value that defines the number of cases required to form any single terminal node, or leaf.

trans-unit.source: Learning rate
trans-unit.target: Learning rate

trans-unit.source: Type a value that defines the step taken at each iteration, before correction.
trans-unit.target: Type a value that defines the step taken at each iteration, before correction.

trans-unit.source: A larger value for learning rate can cause the model to converge faster, but it can overshoot local minima.
trans-unit.target: A larger value for learning rate can cause the model to converge faster, but it can overshoot local minima.

trans-unit.source: Total number of trees constructed
trans-unit.target: Total number of trees constructed

trans-unit.source: Type a value to constrain the number of total trees in the ensemble.
trans-unit.target: Type a value to constrain the number of total trees in the ensemble.

trans-unit.source: Random number seed
trans-unit.target: Random number seed

trans-unit.source: Type a value to use as the seed.
trans-unit.target: Type a value to use as the seed.

trans-unit.source: Specifying a seed value is useful when you want to ensure repeatability across runs of the same experiment.
trans-unit.target: Specifying a seed value is useful when you want to ensure repeatability across runs of the same experiment.

trans-unit.source: Allow unknown categorical levels
trans-unit.target: Allow unknown categorical levels

trans-unit.source: When this option is selected, the model will create a grouping for Unknown values in the training validation sets.
trans-unit.target: When this option is selected, the model will create a grouping for Unknown values in the training validation sets.

trans-unit.source: If you deselect it, the model can accept only the values contained in the training data.
trans-unit.target: If you deselect it, the model can accept only the values contained in the training data.

trans-unit.source: In the former case, the model might be less precise on known values but provide better predictions for new (unknown) values.
trans-unit.target: In the former case, the model might be less precise on known values but provide better predictions for new (unknown) values.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: In general, decision trees yield better results when features are somewhat related.
trans-unit.target: In general, decision trees yield better results when features are somewhat related.

trans-unit.source: If features have a large degree of entropy (that is, they are not related), they share little or no mutual information, and ordering them in a tree will not yield a lot of predictive significance.
trans-unit.target: If features have a large degree of entropy (that is, they are not related), they share little or no mutual information, and ordering them in a tree will not yield a lot of predictive significance.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: For examples of how boosted trees are used in machine learning, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:
trans-unit.target: For examples of how boosted trees are used in machine learning, see these sample experiments in the <externalLink><linkText>Model Gallery</linkText><linkUri>http://gallery.azureml.net/</linkUri></externalLink>:

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Demand estimation</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525271</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses <ui>Boosted Decision Tree Regression</ui> to predict the number of rentals for a particular time.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Demand estimation</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525271</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses <ui>Boosted Decision Tree Regression</ui> to predict the number of rentals for a particular time.

trans-unit.source: The <externalLink><linkText>Twitter sentiment analysis</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525274</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses regression to generate a predicted rating.
trans-unit.target: The <externalLink><linkText>Twitter sentiment analysis</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525274</linkUri></externalLink> sample uses regression to generate a predicted rating.

trans-unit.source: Technical Notes
trans-unit.target: Technical Notes

trans-unit.source: The ensemble of trees is produced by computing, at each step, a regression tree that approximates the gradient of the loss function, and adding it to the previous tree with coefficients that minimize the loss of the new tree.
trans-unit.target: The ensemble of trees is produced by computing, at each step, a regression tree that approximates the gradient of the loss function, and adding it to the previous tree with coefficients that minimize the loss of the new tree.

trans-unit.source: The output of the ensemble produced by MART on a given instance is the sum of the tree outputs.
trans-unit.target: The output of the ensemble produced by MART on a given instance is the sum of the tree outputs.

trans-unit.source: For binary classification problem, the output is converted to probability by using some form of calibration.
trans-unit.target: For binary classification problem, the output is converted to probability by using some form of calibration.

trans-unit.source: For regression problems, the output is the predicted value of the function.
trans-unit.target: For regression problems, the output is the predicted value of the function.

trans-unit.source: For ranking problem, the instances are ordered by the output value of the ensemble.
trans-unit.target: For ranking problem, the instances are ordered by the output value of the ensemble.
